data.title: The Wrecking Crew (2008) Streaming: Watch & Stream Online via Amazon Prime Video, Hulu and Peacock

data.text:
The Wrecking Crew (2008) isn’t a movie about demolition, but rather a love letter to unsung heroes. It tells the story of the elite group of Los Angeles session musicians who, despite never receiving individual credit, played countless hit songs in the 60s and 70s. From “Be My Baby” to “California Dreamin’,” these musical ghosts crafted the soundtracks of a generation, and this documentary finally shines a light on their remarkable talent and untold stories.

Here’s how you can watch and stream The Wrecking Crew via streaming services such as Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, and Peacock.

Is The Wrecking Crew (2008) available to watch via streaming?

Yes, The Wrecking Crew (2008) is available to watch via streaming on Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, and Peacock.

Dive into the untold story of music’s “anonymous superstars” in this movie. This 2008 documentary unveils the lives and contributions of the elite Los Angeles session musicians who, despite never gracing the covers, shaped the sound of the 60s and 70s. Follow iconic tracks like “Be My Baby” and “California Dreamin’,” hearing directly from the drummers, bassists, and guitarists who anonymously brought them to life. Through interviews, vintage footage, and electrifying performances, witness the virtuosity and camaraderie of these hidden figures, finally getting their well-deserved recognition for shaping music history.

Directed by Denny Tedesco, “The Wrecking Crew” doesn’t feature actors in the traditional sense. Instead, it shines a light on real-life session musicians like Hal Blaine, Carol Kaye, and Tommy Tedesco, along with interviews from music giants like Phil Spector and Brian Wilson, offering a unique look at the people who shaped musical eras.

Watch The Wrecking Crew (2008) streaming via Amazon Prime Video

The Wrecking Crew is available to watch on Amazon Prime Video.

It is a streaming service providing a diverse selection of movies, TV shows, and original content. Subscribers also have access to on-demand entertainment, including well-received shows like “The Expanse,” “Jack Ryan,” and “The Grand Tour,” showcasing a variety of genres for a worldwide audience.

You can watch via Amazon Prime Video by following these steps:

Go to Amazon Prime Video

Select ‘Sign in’ and ‘Create your Amazon account’

Sign up for a Prime Video membership:

$14.99 per month or $139 per year with an Amazon Prime membership

$8.99 per month for a standalone Prime Video membership

Amazon Prime is the online retailer’s paid service that provides fast shipping and exclusive sales on products, so the membership that includes both this service and Prime Video is the company’s most popular offering. However, you can also opt to subscribe to Prime Video separately.

Watch The Wrecking Crew (2008) streaming via Hulu

The Wrecking Crew is available to watch on Hulu.

It is a streaming service offering a diverse range of movies, TV shows, and original content. Subscribers can also enjoy popular titles like “The Handmaid’s Tale,” “Brooklyn Nine-Nine,” and “The Great,” making it a versatile platform for varied entertainment preferences.

You can watch via Hulu by following these steps:

Go to Hulu.com/welcome

Select ‘Start Your Free Trial’

Choose a plan:

$7.99 per month or $79.99 per year (With Ads)

$17.99 per month (No Ads)

Hulu (With Ads) is the cheapest option, providing users access to Hulu’s streaming library with commercials. Hulu (No Ads) is the service’s premium option, providing access to its library without any advertisements. There are also several bundles available with Hulu that pair the service with Disney Plus and ESPN Plus, along with Live TV plans that also include many live TV channels.

Watch The Wrecking Crew (2008) streaming via Peacock

The Wrecking Crew is available to watch on Peacock.

It is a streaming service known for its wide variety of content, featuring popular shows like “The Office,” “Yellowstone,” and “Law & Order: SVU.” With a mix of classic favorites and original productions, Peacock also offers a diverse range of entertainment for subscribers.

You can watch via Peacock by following these steps:

Go to PeacockTV.com

Click ‘Get Started’

Choose your payment plan

$5.99 per month or $59.99 per year (premium)

$11.99 per month or $119.99 per year (premium plus

Create your account

Enter your payment details

Peacock’s Premium account provides access to over 80,000+ hours of TV, movies, and sports, including current NBC and Bravo Shows, along with 50 always-on channels. Premium Plus is the same plan but with no ads (save for limited exclusions), along with allowing users to download select titles and watch them offline and providing access to your local NBC channel live 24/7.

The Wrecking Crew’s synopsis is as follows:

“A celebration of the musical work of a group of session musicians known as “The Wrecking Crew.” a band that provided back-up instrumentals to such legendary recording artists as Frank Sinatra, The Beach Boys, and Bing Crosby.”

NOTE: The streaming services listed above are subject to change. The information provided was correct at the time of writing.
